Details: Silicon Valley is home to many of the world’s largest high-tech corporations, including the headquarters of more than 30 businesses in the Fortune 1000, and thousands of startup companies1. Some of the well-known companies based in Silicon Valley are Apple, Google, Facebook, Intel, Cisco, Netflix, Tesla, and Airbnb.

The Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) is one of the most prestigious and innovative universities in the world. It is located in Cambridge, Massachusetts, USA, and it focuses on scientific and technological research and education. MIT has five schools and one college, which offer various programs in engineering, natural sciences, humanities, arts, social sciences, management, and architecture. MIT also has many research centers and laboratories, such as the MIT Media Lab, the MIT Lincoln Laboratory, and the MIT Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (CSAIL)

The NASA Kennedy Space Center is a place where you can witness the history and future of space exploration. It is located on Merritt Island, Florida, and it is one of the ten field centers of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)1. It is also the main launch site for human spaceflight missions, as well as scientific and commercial satellites2.
At the Kennedy Space Center, you can visit various attractions and exhibits that showcase the achievements and challenges of space exploration

Magic Leap, Inc. is an American technology company that released a head-mounted augmented reality display, called Magic Leap One, which superimposes 3D computer-generated imagery over real world objects. It is attempting to construct a light-field chip using silicon photonics.

Place: Smithsonian National Air and Space Museum
Details: The Smithsonian National Air and Space Museum is a place where you can learn about the history and achievements of human flight and space exploration. It is one of the most popular museums in the world

The Microsoft Visitor Center, also known as the Industry Experience Center (IEC), is a high-tech showcase of Microsoft’s digital transformation. Located in Redmond, Washington, the 23,000-square-foot center displays 60 real-world examples of customers and partners innovating their businesses and disrupting markets with Microsoft technologies1.
The IEC features a variety of interactive exhibits that allow visitors to get hands-on with the technologies and explore how they are being used across industries to drive innovation
